history.content: They changed the policy last year so now you cannot retake those classes in order to get a higher grade. The old grade will still count towards the 3.3 average. @3105 --- To answer more generically. At Berkeley, as a university-wide policy: you are allowed to retake a class once only if you get a D+ or worse in it the first time. See https://registrar.berkeley.edu/academic-records/grades for details. For the purpose of computing GPAs for Berkeley CS declaration: as mentioned above, even if you fit the requirements to retake a class, both grades will count towards the average.

They changed the policy last year so now you cannot retake those classes in order to get a higher grade. The old grade will still count towards the 3.3 average. @3105

---

To answer more generically.

At Berkeley, as a university-wide policy: you are allowed to retake a class once only if you failed it the first time. See https://registrar.berkeley.edu/academic-records/grades for details.

For the purpose of computing GPAs for Berkeley CS declaration: as mentioned above, even if you fit the requirements to retake a class, both grades will count towards the average.
They changed the policy last year so now you cannot retake those classes in order to get a higher grade. The old grade will still count towards the 3.3 average. @3105
They changed the policy last year so now you cannot retake those classes in order to get a higher grade. The old grade will still count towards the 3.3 average. @3105
Is it possible to retake 61a, b, or 70 to get a higher cs declaration grade or would the new grade not override the old one? Thanks for the help.
history.subject: Is it possible to retake a class for a higher grade to declare CS?
